message.content: We refer to the definition of NPV in medicine. NPV = true negatives / (true negatives + false negatives). In this case, the true negatives are the 245 patients in the control arm who tested negative, and the false negatives are the 5 patients who tested positive but did not have AIDS. Therefore, NPV = 245 / (245 + 5).

The control arm had 250 patients without AIDS, out of which only 5 tested positive (FP), leaving 245 with a negative test (TN). Thus, the NPV is 245 / (245 + 10) = 0.96 or 96%.
